summary: An email from attorney Bruce Barket requesting three actions related to the Jeffrey Epstein case: viewing physical evidence from Epstein's July 23, 2019 suicide attempt, coordinating a visit to the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) to view cells, and requesting a family visit for his client, Mr. Tartaglione, on March 5, 2020. The email is sent in the context of ongoing legal proceedings.

persons.name: Bruce Barket
persons.context: Author of the email, an attorney at Barket Epstein Kearon Aldea & LoTurco, LLP, making requests related to evidence and visits concerning the Epstein case and his client.

persons.name: Mr. Tartaglione
persons.context: The client of Bruce Barket, for whom a family visit at the MCC is being requested on March 5, 2020.

connections.description: Bruce Barket is acting as the attorney for Mr. Tartaglione, requesting a family visit for him.

events.title: Epstein's Suicide Attempt
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein's suicide attempt at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC). Physical evidence from this event is requested for viewing.

events.title: Requested Family Visit for Tartaglione
events.description: A family visit for Mr. Tartaglione at the MCC is requested by his attorney, Bruce Barket.

locations: 666 Old Country Road, Ste. 700, Garden City, NY 11530 (Barket Epstein Kearon Aldea & LoTurco, LLP office)
keyFacts: The email references a July 23, 2019 suicide attempt by Jeffrey Epstein, and physical evidence from it is requested for viewing.
Attorney Bruce Barket is coordinating a visit to the MCC to view cells, likely related to the Epstein case or his client's conditions.
A family visit for Mr. Tartaglione is requested for March 5, 2020, the day after a scheduled court appearance.
The correspondence is from the law firm Barket Epstein Kearon Aldea & LoTurco, LLP, indicating legal activity surrounding the Epstein case posthumously.
